title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
Hi I got this board a while back but hadn?t bothered to look at it. I?m just trying to learn these repairs and I?m sorry the majority of the boards are old. Anyway I replaced d7005 one of the diodes was no good it had continuity in diode mode in both direction while the other side did not pin 3had 0 continuity to r7005 so I ran a wire. I u7200 had a short to ground on pin 16. Test pin 16 without u7200 .469v Replaced u7200. No I have a green light on the charger and ppbus_g3h is turning on every 30 seconds almost as if it?s sensing a current draw and shouting down.

U7000
chgr_dcin = 16.59v
chgr_acin = 4v
smc_bc_acok = 3.3
pp5v1_chgr_vddp =4.9v
chgr_rst_l =3.41v

u7200
5v3v3s5_reg3=
3v3s5_entrip=

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
3V3_S5 tries to appear?
Post basic voltages for U7200, pins 16, 13, 3, 8, 17.
Post real voltage on pins 1 & 6 too.

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
Hi yes I just rotated  u7200 and now I have good
ppbus_g3h = 12.56v
pp5v_s5 = 5v 
pp3v3_s5 =3.3v
tried power on pads and nothing the pad also has 3.42v
no s3 or s0 rails

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
C7755 correct voltage present?
Post resistance to ground (ohm scale) at L6995; should be higher than 30K.

Check all RTC signals.

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
C7755 pin 1 =.908v
L6995 =5.98m ohms
rtc_rst_L =3.42v 
Rtc_clk32k_xtalin = 1.663v

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message: Will check other ?RTC? signals in a little bit

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
SM_INTRUDER_L and PM_RSMRST_L good?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
Sm_intruder_L =3.4v
pm_rsmrst_L = 3.4v
I?m having a hard time finding a point to check drop pulse at pm_pwrbtn_L one is un smc and the other is under cpu. I don?t see a test point or resistor to test from in between the two points.

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
When I use power on pads 
smc_onoff_L it doesn?t drop or even move

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
Also c2620 is not present and looks like it?s knocked off.
pp3v3r1v8_so_mcp_ifp_vdd on pin 1 pin 2 is gnd

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
"smc_onoff_L it doesn?t drop or even move"
Do you mean is always 3V, or just 0V?

C2620 shouldn't be a reason for not starting, but I recommend you to solder it anyway.
Old platform, no way to measure PM_PWRBTN_L; sorry, didn't check that on schematic.

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message: Sorry I meant it stay high at 3.4v

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
These old machines get failing power button.
Check first if R5710 is good.

Use R5014/15 and check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L.
Be aware, MCP could be bad, after so many years.
You can try heating it...

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message: Shorted the point r5014 got no pulse at I?ve got nothing at pm_slp_s4_L =0v

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
DC value looks good for that oscillation.
I suspect bad MCP; heat it for test...

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
I just found the issue :) it?s the q7860 that gave pm_slp_s4_L
so I wasn?t getting signal. It chimes I have video and I pop in a install dvd all is good so far. Thank you for your time :)

title: 820-2877-b with fluctuations on ppbus_g3h
message:
Glad to hear you've solved it.
And thanks for feedback; it can help other people in the future...
